trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of a combined aerobic and resistance exercise program on people with Type 2 diabetes and peripheral neuropathy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of a combined aerobic and resistance exercise program on strength, function and proprioception in people with diabetic peripheral neuropathy

interventions.interventions: The intervention is a 12-week combined aerobic and resistance exercise program. This will require participants to attend the Health and Fitness Exercise Clinic at the School of Health Sciences at the University of South Australia twice weekly to perform a combination of aerobic and resistance activities at a moderate intensity. All programs will be individually designed and monitored, and supervised by an accredited exercise physiologist. Each session will be 1 hour in duration. During each session participants will be required to perform 20minutes of moderate intensity low weight bearing exercise such as stationary cycling and rowing. Participants will also be required to perform a progressive resistance training program ranging from 50-85% 1RM (repetition maximum). A combination of 8 exercises will be performed for 8-10 repetitions over 2 sets. The exercises will include a bench press, leg extension, leg curl, calf raise, biceps curl, triceps extension, lateral pull-down and a shoulder press.
interventions.comparator: no treatment. The control group will be measured every 4 weeks throught the 12 week intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proprioception as measured by plantar sensation using a Semmes Weinstein Monofilament
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proprioception measured by Vibration Perception Theshold (VPT) using a Biothesiometer
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proprioception measured by Joint Position Sense (JPS) using an electrogoniometer
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of Life as measured using the neuropathic specific quality of life tool, NeuroQol.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at weeks 0 and 12 of the 12 week intervention, as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Short term glycemic control as measured using a blood glucose monitor.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured immediately before and after each individual exercise session.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Long term glycemic control (HbA1c, glycosylated hemoglobin) as measured by each participant's general practitioner.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at weeks 0 and 12 of the intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Muscle strength (isokinetic peak torque) measured using a KinCom Dynamometer
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Physical Function as measured by the modified Physical Performance Test (PPT)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Centre of Pressure during balance measured using a Kistler Force Platform
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured every 4 weeks throughout the intervention as well as 4 weeks prior and 4 weeks post intervention

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: participants will be required to obtain a medical clearance from their General Practitioner prior to the commencement of the study. Participants will be aged between 50-70 years, have had Type 2 diabetes for greater than 6 months controlled by diet and/or hypoglycaemic agents, have peripheral neuropathy as diagnosed by their medical officer, and must be sedentary.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: participants will be excluded if they have Type 1 diabetes or Type 2 diabetes controlled by insulin, a history of recurrent hypoglycaemic episodes within the part 6-months, the presence of any co-morbidities which would inhibit physical activity, and the presence or history of any ulceration, amputation or gangrene.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This research aims to investigate the effects of a combined aerobic and resistance exercise program on measures of strength, function and sensation in those with Type 2 diabetes and peripheral neuropathy. It will also aim to explore the safe prescription of exercise for these individuals, its effects on levels of quality of life, and to identify the potential barriers and enablers to a sustained exercise program.
